    • Method Detail

      • isValidMove

        public boolean isValidMove(int startRow,
                           int startCol,
                           int endRow,
                           int endCol,
                           ChessPiece[][] board)
        The Queen isValidMove function is a combination of the rook and bishop isValidMove checks. The queen can move in any diagonal or cardinal direction as long as no pieces are in her path. The direction is determined by setting verticlePos and horizontalPos. They are set to 1 if in the positive direction, 0 if they are staying in their row or column, and -1 if moving in the negative direction. Afterwards, the chosen direction has its locations tested until finding the end of the board, a piece blocking the queens path, or the desired location. Return true only if desired location is found first.
        Specified by:
        isValidMove in class ChessPiece
        Parameters:
        startRow - startRow is the row of the piece being tested
        startCol - startCol is the column of the piece being tested
        endRow - endRow is the row of the space attempting to be moved to
        endCol - endCol is the column of the space attempting to be moved to
        board - board is the 8x8 chessboard housing all the pieces. This is passed to check for things such as friendly pieces being in the end location, or enemy pieces being in the path of the move.
        Returns:
        isValidMove returns true if the move is acceptable, or false if it breaks the rules

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        toString is the toString override for queens. Queens print a 'w' or 'b' depending on color, followed by a capital 'Q'
        Overrides:
        toString in class ChessPiece
        Returns:
        a String describing the color and that this is a queen
